Hey @CarlBeek, I just noticed the notes on BLS here:
https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/releases/tag/v0.9.1

"Warning: Bug exists in BLS hash to G2 in the current spec. The hash and increment approach will be deprecated after standardization so the bug is to be untouched for now_

Significant changes still expected as we standardize BLS12-381 across blockchains"

Is this new info or are we still on track to finalize spec after IETF meeting?

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**CarlBeek**
That note has been there a long time. It has nothing to do with the standardisation efforts, but the way hashing was implemented in the spec a long time ago. It was decided to leave it like that untill the standardiastion efforts have enshrined the new hash-to-curve to prevent spec chrun. The intention is to update the specs as soon as the standard is agreed upon.
